1 month ago - In late 1986, Activision adopted the Electric Dreams brand, usually used for British software, for titles outside of English for the American market. In 1988, Activision began involvement in software besides video games, such as business applications. As a result, Activision changed its corporate name to Mediagenic to better represent all of its activities. ... Activision: video game publisher ...

1 week ago - By 1997 the company was profitable again. Kotick spent the next decade expanding Activision's products through acquisitions of around 25 studios. This resulted in Activision publishing several successful series of games, including Tony Hawk's, Call of Duty, and Guitar Hero.
Founded in 1979, Activision is the leading worldwide developer, publisher and distributor of blockbuster games available on consoles, mobile and PC.
